Corrupted_ProceduralAPI

Class CorruptedProceduralAPI

  • java.lang.Object
    • Engine.BaseCode
      • Engine.LibraryCode
        • corrupted.Game
          • Corrupted_ProceduralAPI.CorruptedProceduralAPI
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    MethodsToOverride, MyGame

    public class CorruptedProceduralAPI
extends corrupted.Game
    This is a functional API for the game Corrupted. It is designed for use with indroductory computer science lessons. It is intended to help teach: method structure, parameters, conditionals, and for loops. It could be extended to teach arrays. It does not require the use of objects by the students. Note: To allow students to personalize the tiles, have them replace the pngs in the resource folder. They will need to replace: red.png, green.png, yellow.png, blue.png, light_blue.png, purple.png. The size of these pictures in the game is 72 x 72 pixels
    Author:
    Rachel Horton

    • Method Detail

      • buildGame

        public void buildGame()
        To be overridden by the student. This method should be used to "build the world" of the game by drawing key elements. To create a full game, this method should: Place all major elements onto the screen for the game. -Laser -Grid of tiles -Counter Start a timer for the tiles to shift across the screen.

      • updateGame

        public void updateGame()
        To be overridden by the student. This method should be used to "update the world" of the game by checking for user input and win/lose conditions. To create a full game, this method should handle: -Checking for win/lose state -Checking if player presses Up, Down, Left, or Right -Perform tasks depending on input -Update the counter -Delete missed tiles (those that have gone too far left on the screen to be playable)

      • updateCounter

        public void updateCounter()
        Updates the counter to show the remaining number of tiles that need to be matched to win the game.

      • setCounterValue

        public void setCounterValue(int count)

      • drawCounter

        public void drawCounter()
        Draws the counter on the screen.

      • winGame

        public void winGame()
        Sets the game state to win. Calling this method will trigger the win screen to appear.

      • loseGame

        public void loseGame()
        Sets the game state to lost. Calling this method will trigger the lost screen to appear.

      • drawTile

        public void drawTile()
        Draws a single tile on the screen

      • drawBoard

        public void drawBoard()
        Creates a color map which is used to generate random tile colors, so it can draw a board. Draws 26 columns of tiles on the screen to create a grid

      • deleteMissedTiles

        public void deleteMissedTiles()
        Deletes any tiles that have shifted too far left on the screen to be playable.

      • markTileForDelete

        public void markTileForDelete(int x,
                              int y)
        Helper method for deleting tiles. Students should not use this. Marks the tile at location x, y to be deleted on next update.
        Parameters:
        x - the x location of the tile.
        y - the y location of the tile

      • deleteMatchedTiles

        public void deleteMatchedTiles(java.util.ArrayList<structures.IntVector> matches)
        Marks the tiles in the array of matched tiles for deletion. They will be deleted on the next update.
        Parameters:
        matches - An ArrayList of the IntVector locations of matched tiles.

      • deleteMatchingTiles

        public void deleteMatchingTiles()
        Deletes all tiles marked for deletion

      • getColor

        public gridElements.GridElement.ColorEnum getColor(java.lang.String color)
        Translates a String of a color name to a ColorEnum so that old code (on which this API is built) can understand it.
        Parameters:
        color - String of a color name
        Returns:
        ColorEnum that matches the requested color String. If error, will return Cyan by default.

      • checkGameWon

        public void checkGameWon()
        Checks if the player has matched the required number of tiles to win. If yes, displays the win screen.

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        The initialize method is overriding the initialize method in the original game. In the API, it calls buildGame() which is what the students will be writing.
        Overrides:
        initialize in class corrupted.Game

      • update

        public void update()
        The update method is overriding the update method in the original game. In the API, it calls updateGame() which is what the students will be writing.
        Overrides:
        update in class corrupted.Game

      • handlePlayerTileCollision

        public int handlePlayerTileCollision()
        Called when player places a tile. Checks for matches and marks appropriate tiles for deletion.
        Returns:
        the number of matches
